NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Construction work for subsidised residential accommodation

CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Economic Area (EEA), with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 03A02

TITLE.P: Constructional Engineering and landscape works — Ground and Concrete — Sund Sheltered Accommodation Flats, Hidlamyrsvegen 3.

SHORT_DESCR.P: In relation to the construction of new sheltered accommodation flats in Sund kommune, constructional engineering and landscape works, ground and concrete, shall be procured. The work concerns new construction of 20 sheltered accommodation flats with associated common functions, distributed over 2, 2-floor housing wings with intermediate common building with lounge room and kitchen, in addition to a basement with mechanical room and storage room space. The building area is approx. 2 100 m2. The building shall also be connected to Sundheimen with a glass walkway.
Expected construction time is approx. 18 months. Expected start up of the works is 30.4.2018.

The work shall be carried out near another development (Sundheimen nursing home and psychiatry housing) and the contractor must take this into consideration in regard to planning, operation, safety, noise, environment etc.
Construction engineering and landscape work, Ground and Concrete, shall be procured. Scope of the procurement:
— Excavation, blasting, mass replacement for construction and Water and Sewage technical works,
— Securing of cutting to the west,
— New arrival to psychiatric housing as well as reconstruction of the existing road to temporary road for construction purposes,
— Relocation of electricity supply and water and sewage pipes,
— Ground works for the building. Levelling of the site. Levelling for gardening works,
— Expansion of the existing parking place east of the building,
— Walls for mechanical room, the wings of 2 floors,
— Slab over the mechanical room and for the second floor,
— Steel columns for slab and roof structure,

SUITABILITY.P: A) The tenderer shall have their tax, employer contribution and VAT payments in order.
Tax certificates not older than 6 months calculated from the tender deadline.
A Tax Certificate is defined as:
— Tax and VAT certificate issued by the tax office via Altinn.

— Foreign tenderers must submit equivalent certificates from their own country that show that they have an arrangement for the payment of taxes and duties. If the authorities in the relevant country do not issue these certificates, the tenderer should submit a statement which states that all taxes and duties have been paid. The statement shall be approved and signed by the tenderer's Financial Director/ person responsible for finance.
B) The tenderer shall be a legally established company.
— Confirmation that the tenderer is registered in a trade register or company register in accordance with the law in the country where the tenderer is established.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: A) The tenderer shall have sufficient financial strength to be able to fulfil the contract.
The tenderer's Annual Financial Statements including notes with the Board's and auditor's reports from the last 2 years.
If the Annual Financial Statements for the last year are not finished before the tender deadline for this contest expires, the last year's preliminary annual accounts should also be attached.
The Contracting Authority reserves the right to carry out a credit assessment from Experian.
Financial strength is evaluated in relation to turnover, operating profit margin, solidity and liquidity.
The tenderer may choose to rely on other companies’ capacity to fulfil the requirement for the tenderer's economic and financial position. If this is the case, the tenderer must:
— Document the resources of the company/companies on which they will rely.

— Prove that the tenderer has authority over the necessary resources from the subcontractor during the contract period, by, for e.g., submitting a commitment statement, guarantee, cooperation agreement or similar.

This applies regardless of the legal nature of the connection between the companies, i.e. Regardless of whether the supporting company is the tenderer’s parent company, another company in the same group, a cooperating partner etc.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: A) The tenderer shall have sufficient implementation ability.
Documentation requirement:
A short, general description of the company shall be given, including:
— An account of the company’s business concept and core competencies related to the scope of the delivery.
— An overview of the company’s history, organisation and ownership, as well as a description of the current business activities.
— Description of how the service provider is organised for the execution of this contract.
— A concise description of the overall quality assurance system that the supplier will apply in carrying out this contract must be given.
The tenderer may choose to rely on other companies’ capacity to meet the technical and professional qualification requirements. If this is the case, the tenderer must:
— Document the resources of the company/companies on which they will rely.

— Prove that the tenderer has authority over the necessary resources from the sub-contractor during the contract period, by, for e.g., submitting a commitment statement, guarantee, cooperation agreement or similar.

This applies regardless of the legal nature of the connection between the companies, i.e. Regardless of whether the supporting company is the tenderer’s parent company, another company in the same group, a cooperating partner etc.
B) The tenderer shall have good experience from similar assignments. Including previous experience from
Blasting in densely populated areas and works with demanding ground.
Documentation requirement:

Certificates from similar deliveries during the last five years. The certificates should be signed or confirmed in writing by the Contracting Authority for the different deliveries, and as a minimum shall include:
— A brief description of the assignment.
— Time of execution.
— Scope of the assignment in monetary amount.
— Name, and telephone number of the reference person at the Contracting Authority.
If it is not possible to acquire signed or verified attestations, the tenderer shall provide a list of all relevant assignments with descriptions according to the above points.
The Contracting Authority must have the possibility to contact the contact persons who are listed.
C) The tenderer shall respect fundamental human rights and labour rights.
Documentation requirement:
Documented by signing Appendix 4 - self declaration about fulfilment of the eight fundamental ILO conventions.
